title: Honoring Ann Marie Maglione upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the 2011 Silver Bell Award by the Orange County Mental Health Association
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Ann Marie Maglione upon the occasion of
her designation as recipient of the 2011 Silver Bell Award by the Orange
County Mental Health Association

WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and  serve  the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of  this Legislative Body to acknowledge
outstanding individuals whose professional lives, personal endeavors and
community service are an example and inspiration  to  their  colleagues,
friends, and family; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  Ann
Marie  Maglione upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the
2011 Silver Bell Award by the Orange County Mental  Health  Association;
this  auspicious occasion will be celebrated at the 2011 MHA Silver Bell
Ball, to be held on Saturday, February 5, 2011, at the Round Hill  House
in Washingtonville, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Born in Rochester, Minnesota, Ann Marie Maglione relocated to
Poughkeepsie,  New  York,  and then moved to Orange County, New York, in
1987 where she was active in her community, serving on several boards in
addition to being the PTA president of her daughters' school; and
  WHEREAS, Currently, the Director of the Orange County Office  for  the
Aging,  Ann Marie Maglione joined the Mental Health Association (MHA) in
Orange County in 1994 where for nine years she held a variety  of  posi-
tions  involving  community  and  public relations; she was in charge of
special events and initiated several innovative and successful fundrais-
ing programs that continue to be successful; and
  WHEREAS, A staunch advocate for individuals with  mental  illness  and
other  disabilities,  in  1997  Ann  Marie Maglione was appointed to the
Middletown Psychiatric Center Board of Visitors; she became the Center's
Board President and served in this prestigious role until 2006; and
  WHEREAS, Joining the staff of the Orange County Executive in 2003, Ann
Marie Maglione became the Director of the Orange County  Office  of  the
Aging in 2010; and
  WHEREAS,  Residing  in Middletown, New York, Ann Marie Maglione is the
loving mother of two daughters, Nicole and Danielle, who are  her  pride
and joy; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period of her professional and communi-
ty service, a period of constructive involvement, Ann Marie Maglione has
stood  constant  in  dignity,  good  grace and humor, and has earned the
respect and admiration of her colleagues, family and friends; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual for the benefit of others which Ann  Marie  Maglione  has  displayed
throughout her life; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Ann Marie Maglione upon the occasion of her designation as recipi-
ent of the 2011 Silver Bell Award by the  Orange  County  Mental  Health
Association; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Ann Marie Maglione.
